intro: Lastrea filix-mas var. incisa, commonly known as the variegated snake plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves that often display striking variegation. The leaves are typically a mix of green, white, and yellow, which adds to its ornamental appeal. This plant is native to southern Africa and is well adapted to arid environments. It is a low-maintenance plant that thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal watering.
